sentences.en: Boundary extraction of watershed is an important step in forest landscape research.
sentences.cn: 流域边界提取是森林景观研究中的重要步骤.

sentences.en: For leaders in the field like Carr, this year marks a critical watershed.
sentences.cn: 对像卡尔这样的这个领域的领头人来说, 今年是具有重大意义的一年.

sentences.en: Industry expected: July will be a watershed in Guangzhou prices down!
sentences.cn: 业界人士预期: 七月将是广州房价升跌的分水岭!

sentences.en: Internationally, 1959 was a watershed year in film history.
sentences.cn: 就国际层面而言, 1959年是电影历史中具有转折性的一年.

sentences.en: It forms the watershed between the two rivers.
sentences.cn: 它成了两条河流的分水岭.

sentences.en: Stream system is a critical and basic unit of watershed management.
sentences.cn: 河溪系统是流域管理中最基本和最重要的单元.

sentences.en: The advert should only be shown after the 9pm watershed.
sentences.cn: 这则广告只能在晚上9点成人节目开始后才能播出。

sentences.en: The alternative livelihoods strategy well addresses the dual objectives of watershed management.
sentences.cn: 由此可见,替代生计体现着流域管理目标的双重性.

sentences.en: The election of Mary Robinson in 1990 was a watershed in Irish politics.
sentences.cn: 1990年玛丽·鲁滨逊的当选是爱尔兰政治的分水岭。

sentences.en: The flumes are used extensively to measure watershed turnoff.
sentences.cn: 水槽广泛用于测量集水区的经流流量.

sentences.en: The meeting has the potential to be a watershed event.
sentences.cn: 这次会议有可能成为具有转折性的事件。

sentences.en: The middle decades of the 19th century marked a watershed in Russia's history.
sentences.cn: 19世纪中叶标志着俄国历史的转折点。

sentences.en: The watershed total rainfall is expressed by using double integration.
sentences.cn: 利用二重积分表示流域降雨总量.

sentences.en: This often becomes a watershed in mediocrity and genius!
sentences.cn: 这往往就成为了庸才和天才的分水岭!

sentences.en: Tonight could prove to be a watershed for the international career of Barnes.
sentences.cn: 今晚将可能成为巴恩斯国际职业生涯的转折点。

sentences.en: Water resources management, watershed planning and water resources sustainable utilization stratagem study.
sentences.cn: 水资源规划 、 流域规划以及水资源可持续利用战略研究.

words.tran_cn: （美）[水文]流域；[地理]分水岭；集水区；转折点

phrases.tran_cn: 分水岭地区；分水界域；集水面积

trans.tran_cn: 分水岭，集水区，转折点，流域
trans.tran_en: the time in the evening after which television programmes that are not considered suitable for children may be shown in Britain
